posts.name: Vali
posts.cooked:
Hi ! I just red the last expenses report of Signal, the company relying on donations.
Telegram is offering a paid plan for some features (non-limitative of course). To generate more revenue and help Signal‚Äôs mission, we could imagine our own subscription model.

Wht do you think? Any features ideas to suggest?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
valisignal:

Hi ! I just red the last expenses report of Signal, the company relying on donations.

Signal (the organization) has been asking for donations for almost six years. It‚Äôs a non-profit charity. The blog post has been misrepresented in a lot of articles. The point of the blog post wasn‚Äôt to sound alarms, but to provide operational transparency by making it clear what it‚Äôll take to keep Signal operating into the unforeseeable future.

valisignal:

Telegram is offering a paid plan for some features (non-limitative of course).

Telegram isn‚Äôt a charity.

Signal (the organization) has been adamant about keeping Signal (the app) completely free throughout its existence. If they make anything a premium feature, it‚Äôll probably be cloud storage (which they‚Äôre currently building).

• larger attachment limits
  • groups with more members
  • multiple usernames

• More linked devices
  • Receive messages and calls without message request (for business).

Hell NO!

The idea of premium is awful. I love to support free, non commercial products that are working for people not for money.

This idea will ruin all of the ideology of Signal to be charity like service.

I quit telegram because of this idea. Please do not ruin the only hope to better messenger in whole internet

V46YK:
  • larger attachment limits
  • groups with more members
  • multiple usernames

Larger attachments will probably require more people donating to be feasible.

QuickBanana:

More linked devices

You can already link five(?) devices. How many more do you want? I only have two.

QuickBanana:

Receive messages and calls without message request (for business).

No. Please, just no. Businesses can already reach me by phone, email, SMS, RCS‚Ä¶ I spend a lot of time trying to stop businesses from reaching me.

Asker223:
Avitus:

No. Please, just no

Yes. Chat request is one of the BEST option in Signal. I can even say fundamental (after encryption of course)

Read what I said again. I wasn‚Äôt talking about message requests.

Not pay. Donate.

First I don‚Äôt use banks for privacy reasons. There too many breaches in banks.

Second, I can‚Äôt make a monthly donation because I don‚Äôt have a stable income. If donations - user can donate when user CAN and the amount user wants. Without any blocking on feature suspension.

For example if I can donate 15$ this month - I will. But nex month I may be able to donate only 3$

When donating for Signal, I want to help ensure that features become and stay available not only for myself but for all users, including the ones who might not be able to donate. I‚Äôd appreciate Signal not becoming a commercialised aggregation of multiple classes of users as if it was an airline or train with classes of passengers.

posts.edit_reason: A post was merged in by Herohtar

posts.cooked: My preference is that Signal continue to operate and remain an independent organization. Whichever way they achieve that is fine with me. More people need to donate, or they need to create a premium tier. The goal is to keep Signal alive.

I also think that it would be nearly impossible to implement since all Signal is supposed to know is registration number, initial registration date/time, and last accessed date/time. For messages, all that needs to be known is recipient. With those limitations and the fact that all of the clients are open-source, how could Signal limit or provide any user features that are not limited from nor provided to other users?

Avitus:

You can already link five(?) devices. How many more do you want? I only have two.

Still for business that want to handle more customers.

Avitus:

No. Please, just no. Businesses can already reach me by phone, email, SMS, RCS‚Ä¶ I spend a lot of time trying to stop businesses from reaching me.

Calm, it‚Äôs the other way around. Me as a business want to receive cold calls and messages without me having to approve them beforehand.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: That could be its own feature request, I don‚Äôt see what it has to do with a premium plan.

If Signal can find out who Donates (see the Badges) then this will be very easy to do.

It should (correct me if I‚Äôm wrong) essentially be the same Technology

But I‚Äôm not too keen on a Premium-Plan. It will entice to paywall Features to get Subscribers. It will also conflict with their Task of making Messaging available for everyone.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
Neon_44:

If Signal knows who Donates (see the Badges)

they don‚Äôt.

"Badges" feature General Discussion
Takes a deep breath This is from my understanding of how stuff works. I‚Äôm not a crypto expert, I‚Äôm an Android dev, so take some of my explanations with a grain of salt. The general flow for a subscription is like this: Get a Stripe Token from Google Pay, representing one of your payment methods. This should contain minimal information, just enough to allow the card to be authorized. We don‚Äôt request stuff like email, address, etc. Generate a 32-byte identifier on the client using SecureRand‚Ä¶
